The University of Tokyo: The University of Tokyo (UTokyo, 東京大学, Tōkyō daigaku) is a public research university in Bunkyō, Tokyo, Japan. Founded in 1877 by the merger of several pre-westernisation era institutions such as the Shoheizaka Institute (founded in 1605) and Kaiseijo, it is the nation's oldest modern university.[6] The university consists of 10 faculties, 15 graduate schools, and 11 affiliated research institutes.[7] As of 2023, it has a total of 13,974 undergraduate students and 14,258 graduate students.[7]
